page.title: 19Bredwardine; Showplaces.
page.content: Built in the 1880's by a Manchester businessman, Brobury House stands just above Bredwardine Bridge, commanding a magnificent view over the river to the Knapp. The present owner has opened an Art Gallery there and exhibits a fine range of watercolours, etchings and prints from the 16th Century onwards. Visitors may enjoy the gardens which extend to 9 acres. Moccas Court, in Moccas Estate, was built in the 1770's to a design by Robert and James Adam. It is open to the public on Thursday afternoons in the Summer and features several fine rooms, including a circular Dining Room and an oval Hall with a cantilevered staircase. There is some good Georgian and Louis XV furniture , and also paintings of members of the Cornewall family. The once-neglected gardens are being restored.
